newsitem.title: USA: Fed seen refraining from open market operations.
newsitem.headline: Fed seen refraining from open market operations.

text.p: The Federal Reserve is expected to refrain from open market operations on Friday.
"We see no Fed today," said an economist at Stone & McCarthy Research Associates Inc.
Analysts said the five- and 14-day fixed system repurchase agreements carried out on Thursday should be enough to keep liquidity balanced through the weekend.
At 1010 EDT/1410 GMT, federal funds were trading at 5-3/16 percent, below the Fed's target for the rate.
